{"product_results": {"product_id": 12757546309426099378, "title": "Monitor Xiaomi Mi Curved Gaming 34" Wide Quad HD", "reviews": 305, "rating": 4.6}, "reviews_results": {"ratings": [{"stars": 1, "amount": 4}, {"stars": 2, "amount": 8}, {"stars": 3, "amount": 14}, {"stars": 4, "amount": 41}, {"stars": 5, "amount": 238}], "reviews": [{"position": 1, "date": "August 3, 2023", "rating": 4, "source": "JosephS993 · Review provided by pbtech.co.nz", "content": "Good for work. It's sleek and good looking.
I got on sale
I don't use it for gaming, but there is considerable backlight bleed on the corners of my screen when looking from other angles on a black screen.
Not noticeable from normal use and straight on view though.
I noticed some screen tearing when scrolling but I'm not sure if it's because of my drivers.
Specs are very good on paper, but in my opinion the quality doesn't really compete with $1,000+ models.
I love all of the screen real estate, often have to minimize the window to effectively work without swiveling my head to follow my mouse.
Tons of reviews on YouTube which go over colour etc but to me colour looks good.
I had one issue where I moved the screen up and the power cord disconnected.
Pixel quality is like any other screen I've seen, its 1440p but since the screen is so large the pixels are still visible.

Great value, it does what I need it to do (video editing, browsing internet, work), but I can't speak for gamers.
I don't have any issues with it apart from minor screen issues, but it's not enough for me to want a replacement.
I recommend to people who just want an 144h ultrawide with good curve without breaking the bank.

In short, it's probably the best thing you'll get when on sale "}, {"position": 2, "date": "April 20, 2022", "rating": 3, "source": "RobertE16 · Review provided by pbtech.co.nz", "content": "I want to preface this by saying it is one of the cheapest ultrawides of this resolution on the market, however the monitor did not perform as advertised. While it can hit 144hz, when set at that refresh rate my monitor had blurring around the very edges of the screen, most noticeable with text, this issue was resolved when dropping down to 120hz. The displayport cable that came in the box was also faulty, causing visual artifacts while playing games. This issue was also resolved this time with using one of my own display cables.

To me, these issues were tolerable for the price that I paid, although those that are more picky than me may have to make use of the return policy a few times to get a monitor that performs as advertised. As a VA panel you can expect motion blur in very dark scenes as well as on text with the upside being that It can get much darker than an IPS or TN display, this is especially good for those who like to game in a dark room. Unfortunately it's lacking in brightness and as a result whites can come off as very slightly dull and greyish, although fiddling with monitor settings can mostly nullify this issue. The monitor also has a slight green tint which can be improved by increasing the blue balance.

Overall for the price that you pay, you get about the level of quality you would expect. "}, {"position": 3, "date": "June 27, 2022", "rating": 5, "source": "LeszekB · Review provided by pbtech.co.nz", "content": "Had my eye on this monitor for a while, saw a deal come up and got it.

During my research for this monitor I encountered a tonne of conflicting reports, saying the colours are bad, problems with blackness and uneven back light. It confused my decision and made me hold off on buying it. When the deal popped up, I just went for it and hoped for the best.

I'm glad I did. It's beautiful and beyond my expectations.

Build quality is up there with any major brand. Solid, well designed with clever tricks to hide the cables and I love the adjust-ability. Whatever angle I'm sitting at, the screen can be lowered or raised to suit. Setup was a snap with the screen literally snapping into the base and that was it. It also has hardware to mount it to a wall.

I got this screen mainly for looking at charts, browsing and video streaming and, my word, it's outstanding. I can see so much! Not only that, the colours were amazing straight out of the box. It looks better than my old AOC monitor that took weeks of tweaking to get it looking decent. This one - straight up looked good.

Websites look great, text is crisp, photos have more detail than I could ever imagine. Word and Excel docs are a breeze to edit.

I guess I'm a savage and don't see the intricate details that gamers do, to me, this screen is insane and such a steal at this price point. For normal people, you'll simply adore this monitor. Also, the curved screen was very easy to adjust to.

Some tips, change your icon size to 125% or bigger. Makes text and icons easier to see on this mammoth of a display.
For the best resolution, your PC will require a display port. Not HDMI or the large blue plug thing we had back in the day. The monitor comes with the cable so don't buy one unless you require more metres. If you only have HDMI, you'll only get 1080 resolution and trust me, it looks sad on this beast.

You can plug in two devices and split screen as well.

I really have nothing bad to say about this monitor, but to keep it honest; I don't like the

With its sleek Space Gray design and a range of remarkable features, this laptop offers a seamless computing experience like no other.

The MacBook Pro's Space Gray exterior exudes understated elegance, reflecting Apple's timeless design philosophy. Its 13.3" Retina display, featuring True Tone technology, offers vibrant colors, sharp contrast, and excellent clarity, making it a visual treat for any task - work, entertainment, or creative pursuits. The laptop's compact form factor ensures portability while accommodating many features.

Driven by the mighty Apple M2 chip, the MacBook Pro guarantees enhanced performance and responsiveness. The integrated eight-core CPU and graphics cores deliver remarkable speed and smooth multitasking capabilities. Whether editing high-resolution videos, running complex software, or surfing the internet, this laptop ensures impressive performance without compromising efficiency.

With a generous 512GB SSD, the MacBook Pro provides ample storage space to house all your files, applications, and media. The SSD allows for lightning-fast data access and lightning-quick boot-up times. Now, you can effortlessly store your cherished memories, work with large files, and enjoy smoother system performance.

The MacBook Pro's battery life is nothing short of impressive. With its optimized power management system, this laptop offers up to 20 hours of web browsing, video playback, and productivity tasks on a single charge, ensuring uninterrupted daily productivity. Its Thunderbolt/USB, Wi-Fi support, and Bluetooth 5.0 ensure seamless connectivity with various devices and networks.

The MacBook Pro features Apple's sophisticated Magic Keyboard, providing a comfortable typing experience with its precise fundamental mechanisms and responsive touch. The spacious Force Touch trackpad allows for intuitive navigation, precise gestures, and a highly fluid user experience, making tasks feel effortless.

Apple's unwavering commitment to security and privacy is evident in the MacBook Pro. The Touch ID fingerprint sensor integrated into the power button ensures secure laptop access and protects your personal information. The T2 security chip works tirelessly in the background to safeguard your data, providing peace of mind in an increasingly digital world.

In conclusion, the MacBook Pro 13.3" Laptop with the Apple M2 chip is a remarkable device. Its sleek design, powerful performance, remarkable battery life, and cutting-edge features set it apart from the competition. Whether you are a creative professional, a student, or a business executive, this laptop offers an unparalleled computing experience that will elevate your productivity and enjoyment. I purchased a 1TB hard drive for extra storage and I have two 4K monitors hooked up to mine with an adapter that I paid about $200 for. I got this on sale to begin with and that was really nice as the price paid for the adapter that adds support for three 4K monitors, but two is actually more than I thought I needed. I also purchased a mouse and keyboard for mine that are space gray and I’m currently in the process of buying a DAC as I can rip my Japanese MQA CDs from disc to files to playback on my Astell&Kern DAP. I can also stream MQA audio to other devices that support the audio format. That’s why I purchased this device to begin with. This is my third MacBook Pro and it is the smallest one I’ve owned, but I have never had a dual monitor set up with the previous two models and the M2 processor is really fast if you have access to gigabyte internet speeds. None of my previous models had as much memory and I was fortunate enough to get this when it was on sale. Apple has got to stop expecting people to buy new devices every 3 to 5 years. I’ll be the first to admit that Apple is pushing out new devices at a very fast pace and that’s going to hurt their overall business in the long run if they continue to stop supporting their older devices and expect their customers to buy new devices every 3 years. I am completely satisfied with this model and contrary to what some people have posted, the device is very relevant for certain task management. I have two different adapters for this MacBook Pro and one is very heavy and has the ability to add three 4K monitors as it’s powered by a separate power supply

{"product_results": {"product_id": 9018781438562369239, "title": "Samsung Galaxy S21 5G, US Version, 128gb, Purple - Unlocked (Renewed)", "reviews": 4953, "rating": 4.5}, "reviews_results": {"ratings": [{"stars": 1, "amount": 148}, {"stars": 2, "amount": 106}, {"stars": 3, "amount": 271}, {"stars": 4, "amount": 982}, {"stars": 5, "amount": 3446}], "reviews": [{"position": 1, "title": "Solid, well rounded option.", "date": "December 14, 2022", "rating": 5, "source": "Andrew · Review provided by samsung.com", "content": "I am a recovering iPhone user (15 years old) who switched to Samsung about 6 months ago, because my iPhone SE battery life was abysmal, and I found the phone locked down, and freedomless. I bought this s22 plus, even though everybody has iPhones at my school, and made fun of me for wanting a Samsung. That soon changed, however, as I began saving their lives when their batteries kept dying, and they didn't have their charger by using the power share function. I even charged a pair of AirPods for my friend, and everyone in the room was wondering why you couldn't do so on Apple's own iPhone. The fact that Samsung phones have better integration with Airpods in some aspects than iPhones, should be embarrassing to Apple. There are so many different features and aspects of this phone that I love, including the camera, screen, durable construction, One UI 5, power share, superior clipboard, integration with Windows PCs, etc... The whole phone is just so well-rounded, and there really isn't anything to complain about. Everything just works how you'd expect it to. The only things I could think of are better-sounding speakers, and the ability to power share while plugged in. If you choose this phone you are essentially going to get a well-rounded option that checks all the boxes, simply does what you want it to, and will last for years to come. Samsung focused on what their customers wanted with this phone(except removing the sd card slot ): ), and every detail is there for your best interest. Although Apple has its advantages, people need to get over their iPhone loyalty and look at what other companies have to offer. If you never have an open mind, you'll never know how good an iPhone really is. I'm not saying that iPhones are complete trash, I just want to tell people about the great experience I have had with Samsung and give them the confidence to try it for themselves. Who knows, it could be the perfect fit! "}, {"position": 2, "title": "Packed full of features", "date": "March 14, 2023", "rating": 5, "source": "Nathan · Review provided by samsung.com", "content": "This phone is such an amazing device. The build quality makes it feel premium as it should, the cameras are great, and full of great features that I enjoy using on a daily basis. For me, this phone is incredibly convenient because of these features. For instance, the pop up window is so good. Sometimes when I'm working in a particular app and I receive a notification that needs my attention and I don't want to exit the app I'm using, I can just open Finder and open up that other app in pop up window. It's so convenient. Other times I need to use two apps at once and this phone allows for me to work in both apps simultaneously. This device is a multi tasking machine and I love it so much. The edge panel is another thing I find handy. I can put my most used apps in the edge panel readily available and close by for me to use. The thing I love the most about this phone is how customizable it is: from the way the app icons look, the theme, the wallpapers, etc. I found that the handiest tool was the side key commands. Like it is quicker to launch the flashlight with by just pressing the side key twice to turn it on and off. I just find it quicker compared to having to turn on the phone and keep on scrolling the drop down menu and look for the flashlight. Another favorite of mine is the management of notifications. It is so clean and organized the way this phone handles notifications compared to iPhones. "}, {"position": 3, "title": "Better and better", "date": "March 13, 2023", "rating": 5, "source": "Josias · Review provided by samsung.com", "content": "For the longest time, I've always owned and used Samsung phones from the S series. With each an every new one that comes out, it only gets better.

This is apparent with this recent S22+ I purchased. Compared to previous years, my S22+ has majorly improved my daily life. The improvements to hardware and software make this phone a joy to have.

For one, the hardware has improved across all aspects, which in turn has improved my enjoyment.

For example, the cameras have improved tremendously over the past years. The addition of the telephoto zoom is also very fun to use. As an casual photographer, I appreciate having a high performance camera in my pocket.

Another great piece of hardware is the screen. In the past, I used to get the smaller model because it was easier to hold. However, this time around having the S22+ bigger screen size is a feature I am not willing to compromise. The size alongside the amazing quality and OLED display makes media a blast to watch.

The software has also improved over time. I am very satisfied with the recent updates to OneUI. It has made the phone more customizable and optimized.

Additionally, the Bixby assistant, to my surprise, has been a huge help in my day to day life. It is very easy to have Bixby create events, timers, reminders, and much more with the push of a button.

Overall, I am extremely happy with my purchase, and I look forward with anticipation to what Samsung has to offer in the future "}, {"position": 4, "title": "Excellent investment - fantastic operating

{"product_results": {"product_id": 9018781438562369239, "title": "Samsung Galaxy S21 5G, US Version, 128gb, Purple - Unlocked (Renewed)", "reviews": 4953, "rating": 4.5}, "reviews_results": {"ratings": [{"stars": 1, "amount": 148}, {"stars": 2, "amount": 106}, {"stars": 3, "amount": 271}, {"stars": 4, "amount": 982}, {"stars": 5, "amount": 3446}], "reviews": [{"position": 1, "title": "Solid, well rounded option.", "date": "December 14, 2022", "rating": 5, "source": "Andrew · Review provided by samsung.com", "content": "I am a recovering iPhone user (15 years old) who switched to Samsung about 6 months ago, because my iPhone SE battery life was abysmal, and I found the phone locked down, and freedomless. I bought this s22 plus, even though everybody has iPhones at my school, and made fun of me for wanting a Samsung. That soon changed, however, as I began saving their lives when their batteries kept dying, and they didn't have their charger by using the power share function. I even charged a pair of AirPods for my friend, and everyone in the room was wondering why you couldn't do so on Apple's own iPhone. The fact that Samsung phones have better integration with Airpods in some aspects than iPhones, should be embarrassing to Apple. There are so many different features and aspects of this phone that I love, including the camera, screen, durable construction, One UI 5, power share, superior clipboard, integration with Windows PCs, etc... The whole phone is just so well-rounded, and there really isn't anything to complain about. Everything just works how you'd expect it to. The only things I could think of are better-sounding speakers, and the ability to power share while plugged in. If you choose this phone you are essentially going to get a well-rounded option that checks all the boxes, simply does what you want it to, and will last for years to come. Samsung focused on what their customers wanted with this phone(except removing the sd card slot ): ), and every detail is there for your best interest. Although Apple has its advantages, people need to get over their iPhone loyalty and look at what other companies have to offer. If you never have an open mind, you'll never know how good an iPhone really is. I'm not saying that iPhones are complete trash, I just want to tell people about the great experience I have had with Samsung and give them the confidence to try it for themselves. Who knows, it could be the perfect fit! "}, {"position": 2, "title": "Packed full of features", "date": "March 14, 2023", "rating": 5, "source": "Nathan · Review provided by samsung.com", "content": "This phone is such an amazing device. The build quality makes it feel premium as it should, the cameras are great, and full of great features that I enjoy using on a daily basis. For me, this phone is incredibly convenient because of these features. For instance, the pop up window is so good. Sometimes when I'm working in a particular app and I receive a notification that needs my attention and I don't want to exit the app I'm using, I can just open Finder and open up that other app in pop up window. It's so convenient. Other times I need to use two apps at once and this phone allows for me to work in both apps simultaneously. This device is a multi tasking machine and I love it so much. The edge panel is another thing I find handy. I can put my most used apps in the edge panel readily available and close by for me to use. The thing I love the most about this phone is how customizable it is: from the way the app icons look, the theme, the wallpapers, etc. I found that the handiest tool was the side key commands. Like it is quicker to launch the flashlight with by just pressing the side key twice to turn it on and off. I just find it quicker compared to having to turn on the phone and keep on scrolling the drop down menu and look for the flashlight. Another favorite of mine is the management of notifications. It is so clean and organized the way this phone handles notifications compared to iPhones. "}, {"position": 3, "title": "Better and better", "date": "March 13, 2023", "rating": 5, "source": "Josias · Review provided by samsung.com", "content": "For the longest time, I've always owned and used Samsung phones from the S series. With each an every new one that comes out, it only gets better.

This is apparent with this recent S22+ I purchased. Compared to previous years, my S22+ has majorly improved my daily life. The improvements to hardware and software make this phone a joy to have.

For one, the hardware has improved across all aspects, which in turn has improved my enjoyment.

For example, the cameras have improved tremendously over the past years. The addition of the telephoto zoom is also very fun to use. As an casual photographer, I appreciate having a high performance camera in my pocket.

Another great piece of hardware is the screen. In the past, I used to get the smaller model because it was easier to hold. However, this time around having the S22+ bigger screen size is a feature I am not willing to compromise. The size alongside the amazing quality and OLED display makes media a blast to watch.

The software has also improved over time. I am very satisfied with the recent updates to OneUI. It has made the phone more customizable and optimized.

Additionally, the Bixby assistant, to my surprise, has been a huge help in my day to day life. It is very easy to have Bixby create events, timers, reminders, and much more with the push of a button.

Overall, I am extremely happy with my purchase, and I look forward with anticipation to what Samsung has to offer in the future "}, {"position": 4, "title": "Excellent investment - fantastic operating

This is apparent with this recent S22+ I purchased. Compared to previous years, my S22+ has majorly improved my daily life. The improvements to hardware and software make this phone a joy to have.

For one, the hardware has improved across all aspects, which in turn has improved my enjoyment.

For example, the cameras have improved tremendously over the past years. The addition of the telephoto zoom is also very fun to use. As an casual photographer, I appreciate having a high performance camera in my pocket.

Another great piece of hardware is the screen. In the past, I used to get the smaller model because it was easier to hold. However, this time around having the S22+ bigger screen size is a feature I am not willing to compromise. The size alongside the amazing quality and OLED display makes media a blast to watch.

The software has also improved over time. I am very satisfied with the recent updates to OneUI. It has made the phone more customizable and optimized.

{"product_results": {"product_id": 9018781438562369239, "title": "Samsung Galaxy S21 5G, US Version, 128gb, Purple - Unlocked (Renewed)", "reviews": 4953, "rating": 4.5}, "reviews_results": {"ratings": [{"stars": 1, "amount": 148}, {"stars": 2, "amount": 106}, {"stars": 3, "amount": 271}, {"stars": 4, "amount": 982}, {"stars": 5, "amount": 3446}], "reviews": [{"position": 1, "title": "Solid, well rounded option.", "date": "December 14, 2022", "rating": 5, "source": "Andrew · Review provided by samsung.com", "content": "I am a recovering iPhone user (15 years old) who switched to Samsung about 6 months ago, because my iPhone SE battery life was abysmal, and I found the phone locked down, and freedomless. I bought this s22 plus, even though everybody has iPhones at my school, and made fun of me for wanting a Samsung. That soon changed, however, as I began saving their lives when their batteries kept dying, and they didn't have their charger by using the power share function. I even charged a pair of AirPods for my friend, and everyone in the room was wondering why you couldn't do so on Apple's own iPhone. The fact that Samsung phones have better integration with Airpods in some aspects than iPhones, should be embarrassing to Apple. There are so many different features and aspects of this phone that I love, including the camera, screen, durable construction, One UI 5, power share, superior clipboard, integration with Windows PCs, etc... The whole phone is just so well-rounded, and there really isn't anything to complain about. Everything just works how you'd expect it to. The only things I could think of are better-sounding speakers, and the ability to power share while plugged in. If you choose this phone you are essentially going to get a well-rounded option that checks all the boxes, simply does what you want it to, and will last for years to come. Samsung focused on what their customers wanted with this phone(except removing the sd card slot ): ), and every detail is there for your best interest. Although Apple has its advantages, people need to get over their iPhone loyalty and look at what other companies have to offer. If you never have an open mind, you'll never know how good an iPhone really is. I'm not saying that iPhones are complete trash, I just want to tell people about the great experience I have had with Samsung and give them the confidence to try it for themselves. Sometimes when I'm working in a particular app and I receive a notification that needs my attention and I don't want to exit the app I'm using, I can just open Finder and open up that other app in pop up window. It's so convenient. Other times I need to use two apps at once and this phone allows for me to work in both apps simultaneously. This device is a multi tasking machine and I love it so much. The edge panel is another thing I find handy. I can put my most used apps in the edge panel readily available and close by for me to use. The thing I love the most about this phone is how customizable it is: from the way the app icons look, the theme, the wallpapers, etc. I found that the handiest tool was the side key commands.
